title: ag.algebraic geometry - Galois action of Weil restriction
body: Let $K/\mathbb{Q}$ be a quadratic field. Let $E$ be an elliptic curve defined over $K$ but not over $\mathbb{Q}$ , and let $\bar{E}$ be the Galois conjugate of $E$ . Then by the descent theory (for instance, see section h ), we can construct an abelian surface $A:=Res_{K/\mathbb{Q}}(E)$ , which is isomorphic to $E\times \bar{E}$ over $K$ (but not like to be over $\mathbb{Q}$ ). With this setup, my question is: Knowing the $Gal(\overline{K}/K)$ -action attached to the Tate module $T_{\ell}(E)$ , how to compute the $Gal(\overline{\mathbb{Q}}/\mathbb{Q})$ -action attached to the Etale cohomology $H^2_{et}(A, \mathbb{Q}_{\ell})$ ? For instance, given a good prime $p$ of $A$ (i.e. the reduction of $A$ at $p$ is still smooth), then what is the trace of Frobenius $p$ at $H^2_{et}(A, \mathbb{Q}_{\ell})$ ? In particular, if there is an isogeny from $E$ to $\bar{E}$ , can we understand the transcendental part of $H^2_{et}(A,\mathbb{Q}_{\ell})$ as symmetric square of $T_{\ell}(E)$ ? I apolgies if the question is too complicated. Any suggestion or reference is welcome. And please feel free to add conditions if you think that is necessary for get the answer. ag.algebraic-geometry nt.number-theory arithmetic-geometry etale-cohomology galois-representations Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 19, 2020 at 4:30 GH from MO 116k 8 8 gold badges 326 326 silver badges 442 442 bronze badges asked Jun 19, 2020 at 4:10 Leo D 543 2 2 silver badges 7 7 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 6 $\begingroup$ The Tate module of $A$ is the induced module of the Tate module for $E$.. The $H^1$ for $A$ is the dual of its Tate module, and $H^2(A)=\wedge^2 H^1(A)$. $\endgroup$ anon –  anon 2020-06-19 07:41:00 +00:00 Commented Jun 19, 2020 at 7:41 $\begingroup$ Thanks @anon, I think you are right. It's kind of embarring that I didn't realize that the induced representation is the answer. $\endgroup$ Leo D –  Leo D 2020-06-20 23:29:25 +00:00 Commented Jun 20, 2020 at 23:29 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
